p: In recent years, there has been a growing trend in the global population, as about 80% of people worldwide rely on the use of herbal medicines and supplements for their primary health care needs [ 1, 2]. This growing demand for herbal medicines encourages new research and drug developments [ 2]. In fact, many active ingredients of new drugs are derived from medicinal plants that have been shown to be extremely important in supporting the discovery and development of drugs [ 3]. It is therefore necessary to carry out active research on plants in order to identify potential candidates as safer and more effective agents in the future.
